010package imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive;
011
012import ij.plugin.filter.RankFilters;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogLabel;
015import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * This is an implementation of the adaptive thresholder proposed by Bernsen in [1].
020 * It uses a circular support region implemented with ImageJ's built-in rank-filter methods.
021 * See Sec. 9.2.1 of [2] for a detailed description.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] J. Bernsen. Dynamic thresholding of grey-level images. In “Proceedings
025 * of the International Conference on Pattern Recognition (ICPR)”,
026 * pp. 1251–1255, Paris (October 1986). IEEE Computer Society.
027 * <br>
028 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/04/02
033 */
034public class BernsenThresholder implements AdaptiveThresholder {
035        
036        /**
037         * Parameters for class {@link BernsenThresholder}.
038         */
039        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
040                @DialogLabel("Radius")
041                public int radius = 15;
042                
043                @DialogLabel("c_min")
044                public int cmin = 15;
045                
046                @DialogLabel("Background mode")
047                public BackgroundMode bgMode = BackgroundMode.DARK;
048        }
049        
050        private final Parameters params;
051        
052        public BernsenThresholder() {
053                this.params = new Parameters();
054        }
055        
056        public BernsenThresholder(Parameters params) {
057                this.params = params;
058        }
059
060        @Override
061        public ByteProcessor getThreshold(ByteProcessor I) {
062                final int M = I.getWidth();
063                final int N = I.getHeight();
064                ByteProcessor Imin = (ByteProcessor) I.duplicate();
065                ByteProcessor Imax = (ByteProcessor) I.duplicate();
066
067                RankFilters rf = new RankFilters();
068                rf.rank(Imin, params.radius, RankFilters.MIN);
069                rf.rank(Imax, params.radius, RankFilters.MAX);
070
071                int q = (params.bgMode == BackgroundMode.DARK) ? 256 : 0;
072                ByteProcessor Q = new ByteProcessor(M, N);
073
074                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
075                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
076                                int gMin = Imin.get(u, v);
077                                int gMax = Imax.get(u, v);
078                                int c = gMax - gMin;
079                                if (c >= params.cmin)
080                                        Q.set(u, v, (gMin + gMax) / 2);
081                                else
082                                        Q.set(u, v, q);
083                        }
084                }
085                return Q;
086        }
087        
088}
